newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 sets record high on Wall St surge.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 sets record high on Wall St surge.

text.p: UK shares soared to a record peak on Tuesday, taking their cue from a resumption of the strong rally on Wall Street.

The FTSE 100 index swept past the key psychological resistance point of 4,700 to close up 52.9 points at 4,739.6, breaking the previous closing and intraday peaks set on May 16. Trading volume was around 800 million shares.

"Wall Street was a very big help today," said one dealer. "There were no sellers around and shares are being continually squeezed higher...it's a combination of the lack of selling and the huge amount of liquidity in the market."
